mechanoreception.notes: Likely important for host detection and mate finding. Males use antennae to cling to females, suggesting mechanosensory receptors on the antennae.

chemoreception.notes: Likely important for host detection, as they are parasitic copepods. May also play a role in mate finding.

vision.notes: Presence and importance of vision in this family are unknown based on the provided context. Given their parasitic lifestyle, vision may be reduced or absent in some species.
